title: Challenger Rewards account sweep in progress
body:
It's been a while since the season ended, so as an update, here’s where we are in the Challenger rewards distribution process. As mentioned in the [Challenger Rewards intro post](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/competitive/2016-challenger-rewards), we’re checking each qualifying account for win trading, elo boosting, toxicity, scripting, and other behavior that violates the Summoner’s Code. This process will take a few weeks. Accounts that are ineligible for in-game rewards will also be ineligible for the Challenger physical rewards.

**If an account is ineligible, both physical and in-game rewards will pass down to the next eligible individual or team on the list. **

When the review wraps up in December, players who earned rewards will be notified via their account’s [verified email address](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201751744-Email-Verification-FAQ). This will include instructions for how to claim rewards, and players will have roughly one month from the time of the email to confirm their details. We’ll have another update when the emails are ready to go out!

But that's not how **reality** works.

Yes, the enemy team has a higher chance of getting a feeder, an AFK or whatever, but with a sample of millions of people a chance of 1/50000th isn't as unlikely as you believe it is.

Why do you have confidence in Riot placing people correctly when this whole conversation came about because of a problem causing people to be definitely not be placed correctly (e.g. diamonds in bronze)? Why would you be so confident th at the "potential fix" was going to solve all problems?

If we know that Riot was placing high elos too low and vice versa, then it would make sense that high elos would be placed higher and low elos would be placed lower.

The problem is, we don't know the exact threshold at which you wouldn't need your rank to change from the previous to make room for more high elos.
